message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.IT, cs.NE, cs.SY

This paper deals with the reconstruction of images from binary pixel measurements, which is a problem in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the use of a sparse synthesis prior, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.MM). The paper also mentions the use of maximum-likelihood (ML) approach, which is a statistical technique used in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the hardware-friendly real-time approximation of the inverse operator, which is a problem in control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper deals with the design of image sensors, which is a problem in neural engineering (cs.NE).
